headline: Basil Cream Sauce
description: Creamy basil sauce made with typical pesto ingredients (basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan) plus light cream. Try it over pasta, salmon, or chicken.
name: Basil Cream Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Combine basil and garlic in a food processor. Pour oil in slowly, with the processor running, until mixture begins to emulsify, about 40 seconds. Add Parmesan, pine nuts, salt, and pepper; blend for 1 minute.
Bring cream to a simmer in a saucepan over low heat. Pour 1/2 of the hot cream into the food processor, and pulse for 20 seconds until incorporated with basil mixture.
Transfer basil-cream mixture to the saucepan. Stir with cream until well blended, then simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! Made it exactly as described and put it on homemade pasta.
I made this with penne and chicken. Very good, didn't change a thing!
excellent! really recommend this!

Tweaked it by subbing 1 tbps dried basil and 1 tbsp dried parsely for the fresh basil. Used extra virgin olive oil for the roux. Added 1/2 c organic chicken stock. Upped cheese to 2/3 c. Very nice multi-purpose base sauce, almost any cheese will work. I use it for baked pasta dishes.
Made just as is!! Easy and so good!!!

LOVED IT! However, I also made a little change as another reviewer stated to make a rue with some butter and flour before adding the cream. Also, I used Half and Half instead because it's what I had available and it truly turned out amazing. We really like things to be extra garlicky, so I used six cloves of garlic rather than four, but I'm sure four would've be absolutely yummy for those who don't go crazy for that extra kick. Definitely will be making this again.
This is now a staple for our family. Great on fresh pasta and salmon. Excellent and easy.

My pesto sauce lost its green appearance after mixing in the cream. I measured 2 cups of basil leaves but maybe I was supposed to pack them in the measuring cup tighter.

Also, there wasn't enough sauce to properly coat 2 lbs of noodles. I will have to triple the recipe next time and only cook 1 lb of linguine to get the proper sauce to pasta ratio because I can taste the potential. 

Overall, this is a quality recipe. I just need to work out the kinks on my end because I'm new to cooking this dish and cooking in general as you have probably already noticed. Ha

I'm new to basil, and this sauce is my new favorite using it. I made the mistake of planting the basil with tiny leaves, so it took forever to harvest enough -- next time, I'm going for the giant ones, lol -- but the sauce is well worth the effort. I served it over farfalle with blackened shrimp, and my husband and I both loved it. My only changes were to add a bit of oregano and using cornstarch to thicken it a bit. Thanks!

delicious - I made this pesto with my own home grown basil. & and served this with shrimp-- except 1 cup of half & half was enough - 2 cups of cream would of been too much and it did thicken just right and I use penne pasta
I love this recipe. It was easy to make. The only thing I didn’t add was salt and that’s because it was flavorful enough without it.
I used this recipe to rescue a container of leftover fettuccine and garlic shrimp. Everyone thought I cooked a completely new disband
I used roasted almond slivers instead of pine nuts and an Italian cheese blend. My whole family loved this. Served with Italian chicken. Good Stuff!
Delicious. I made it using heavy cream which turned out to be perfect.

Turned out great! I ended up searing pork medallions then finishing the cooking in the sauce on the stovetop (reserving some for later)then topping it with fresh sauce. Turned out fantastic! Will make again!
LOVED it. Made it just as written except I didn't have 2 oz of pine nuts, more like 3T. Used my garden basil, tossed the sauce with some pasta and grilled chicken.
We love it on our zoodles! Used heavy cream and extra olive oil.
It's amazing
I didn't have pine nuts, so it missed that flavor that it typical with pesto, but still good. Easy to make.
I like this recipe alot. Put it on salmon.

This sauce is perfect for the type of dish I was going for. It has a very savory flavor from the basil and garlic. One added thing I loved was how it reheated without issue. The family enjoyed the leftovers.

I halved the recipe and used a mini-processor. I used jarred garlic and mostly half-and-half with a little milk. Nice flavor and went well over angel hair pasta. Will be good over ravioli gnocchi another time.

This was easy, but I didn't think it was anything special. I mixed 20 oz of tortellini into it and it was too much sauce. I added 1/2 pound of cooked broccoli the next day and that seemed to be a better ratio of stuff to sauce. The ground nuts act as a thickening agent, so if you choose to skip them, you'll need to thicken the sauce a different way.

Yummy! Real easy to make, although used almonds instead. Super yummy on some spinach and ricotta manicottis, or just toasted french bread for appetizer. The boyfriend gets so excited whenever I make this!
Good basic recipe. Required a little more seasonings than the recipe called for and it needed to be thickened with cornstarch. Very pleased with end results,

This sauce was excellent! However, because I am a health nut, I used culinary dairy free coconut milk from "So Delicious" instead of the cream. It was still yummy, and the only downside of this sauce, and this was most likely because of the coconut milk, is that the texture was a bit funny, but overall I do recommend this.

This sauce was great! I needed a good, easy, recipe to make with my girlfriend since we were both not happy with store-bought sauces. We only did one cup of basil because 2 cups seemed like a bit much and we forgot to add the pine nuts but it was still great. id recommend this to anyone who wants to have a "make it yourself" date night. (If you LOVE basil, do the full 2 cups. If you just LIKE it, only do 1 cup.)

Have made this twice now....once over the Christmas holidays for family and another just for a casual dinner with friends. Rave reviews both times....will definitely put this in the regular rotation! Thanks for the recipe :)
I love this recipe although I use the heavy cream rather than the light cream and I omit the pine nuts.
Yum! Used a heavier cream because that's what I had so diluted it with milk. Very easy to make and a HUGE HIT in my house! I made it last week and making it again this week.
Delicious. My wife found this recipe and makes this regularly. The Kids even eat it.

I followed directions exactly and it was quick, easy, and tasted awesome! I don't see the need to make a rue... I wouldn't use anything much heavier than 1/2 &1/2; after simmering it after combining everything, it was plenty thick.

Tried it this weekend with one chopped roma tomato, 1/2 a red pepper, one can of artichokes, fresh baby spinach sautéd in olive oil and grilled chicken over fettucini noodles. Should have been the spinach fettucini, but could not find at the super market I was at. The added ingredients meant I had to cook sauce a bit longer for it to thicken, but it was a hit and I'll definitely make it again.

Came out delicious! Had to keep it old school and use a mortar since I don't own a food processor. Even my picky mother that only admits to liking her own cooking told me it was delicious and cleaned her plate. I'm looking forward to making it again.

wonderful! i did use fattier reg cream and I was out of parmesan so i used sharp provolone i had and it was incredible! can't wait to make it again! thank you! it tasted exactly like pesto sauce I had at a local Italian restaurant!

wonderful! i did use fattier reg cream and I was out of parmesan so i used sharp provolone i had and it was incredible! can't wait to make it again! thank you! it tasted exactly like pesto sauce I had at a local Italian restaurant!

This was a great sauce, I made a few modifications- Half & half instead of cream which I used about 8oz + 2T of butter. Also, I threw everything in the food processor at once except for the olive oil, it didn't seem necessary to do it in 2 steps. Added more garlic because I always add more garlic :) Tossed it with fusilli, some of the pasta water and two large, diced, tomatoes. My boyfriend and I loved it.

This was great! Added some garlic powder instead of garlic since that's what I had. As suggested, made a roux from butter and flour and then added the cream and whisked often until thickened. This will be my new go-to white sauce.

Outstanding! I followed the recipe exactly, and would not change a thing! I ate it on grilled chicken and pasta. I even licked my plate. ;)

Oh, I also licked the sauce pan.
I made some changes... I used half the amount of basil and used sage, artichoke hearts & a couple green olives. When the sauce came together I served it with sausage and ravioli. It was AMAZING!
excellent recipe! .- Pals

I added about 1/2 cup more Parm because my family is cheese crazy, but it retained the basil flavor and was a wonderful sauce. Perfect for Lenten Friday, a nice change of pace from tomato based sauces.

Great recipe! Omitted the pine nuts and added a bit more garlic in their place (I'm a big fan of garlic); I also used very light olive oil- just my preference. I followed the instructions and it turned out great. It's light, creamy and very 'fresh' tasting (thank you, basil!) 
The perfect compliment to my oven baked salmon- so yummy!

Oh, Caution- this makes a HUGE amount of sauce! Not too much of a problem for us, because it Does reheat without issue and, it turns out, is also tasty on rice and chicken :). Maybe next time I will halve the recipe or just be ready to freeze the leftovers for later.

**And yes, this *is* a basil sauce- naturally the primary flavor is basil, so if you're not looking for that, I'd steer clear. (Not sure why you'd make a basil sauce if you don't like basil, but hey- no judgement here! :) ).

the recipe was a bit bland, so i added some sun-dried tomatoes to liven it up. there was a bit too much cream. a bit watery even after using less cream than required, so i had to add flour and extra parmesan (like some of the others) to firm up my sauce.

once it was fixed up, it was delicious! all was gone in one night!
Yummy! Yummy! Yummy! I had a ton of basil from my garden I wasn't sure what to with, when I came across this recipe. Made it with no changes and is delicious!! Perfect on pasta!

not too bad not too bad! It does taste a little flat to me, but its highly likely that I ended up substituting some of the fresh basil with dried (oops!) it did take more than 5 minutes to thicken up for me though.

Yum! I've never made pesto before and this recipe is a good reason to make it again! I used almonds b/c it's what I had on hand. I took 1/4 c. of the pesto (before adding salt, pepper, and cream) and mixed it with 2 oz. of butter and 2 oz. of cream cheese (from another reviewer's suggesiton). It made the most delicious spread!
This is the first time pesto turned out for me - I like the cream base. I used my stick blender and sunflower seeds (raw). It was awesome and my family all enjoyed it.
Awesome - the only way to go with Pesto. the cream really makes it. I've used raw almonds in place of pine nuts and it turned out wonderfully.
very delicious. sooo good. yum. i have never tasted anything so good in my life. i am gonna get some more! ;)
Amazing. Absolutely yummy! Had it over baked salmon and we devoured it! We are using the balance over pasta tomorrow with the balance of the flaked salmon. Healthy and tasty...go figure.

This was a very tasty, easy sauce to make. I followed other suggestions here and thickened the sauce with a rue of melted butter and flour. I also used half and half instead of light cream simply because I didn't have the cream on hand. Very similar in flavor to Maggiano's Basil Cream Sauce that they serve over ravioli in their restaurants. I'll be honest and say that next time I believe I will roast the garlic cloves before adding them to the basil since the raw garlic flavor was a bit overpowering at first. My family loves fresh grated parmesan cheese so I added extra to the sauce and then grated some over top of our ravs. I could see serving this to guests with pan seared chicken and pasta.
Absolutely delicious!!!! and so easy to make :) those fresh basil leaves mixing in with pine nut pieces really created a powerful flavor!
Not an especially impressive sauce. Good because it's quick and easy, but you may as well buy some pesto.

Fabulous!! This recipe was exactly what i have been searching for. Flavorful, creamy, and fresh!!! I substituted almonds instead of using the pine nuts. This is wonderful over chicken, pasta and even rice.
This was really delicious!! Mike and I both loved this.
tooo much basil...otherwise, not a bad start for a garnishing sauce

Yum!! Fast and so easy! I used fat free milk instead of cream that I thickened with corn starch in the microwave! Next time I will add a dash of red pepper flakes. I will be making this again and again. Perfect for company-just add shrimp or chicken, top with fresh diced tomatoes, chopped basil and a bit of fresh parmesan! Like I said...Yum!!!

Yum! Oh my goodness, soo delicious!

I used almonds instead of pine nuts and half and half instead of cream. I mixed the remaining half of the liquid in the pan with a bit of flour and cream cheese to thicken it up. I also added another garlic clove, a few dashes of onion salt, pepper, oregano, and dash of sugar.

I divided the recipe in half and still had plenty for 5 or 6 servings, due to the fact that I kept adding milk and half and half in an attempt to thin it out a bit. . . still very thick. I served it with basil garlic shrimp over spinach pasta from this site. This is one of those meals that makes me wonder why I even bother going out to eat. . . it doesn't get better than this! Try it! Thanks for an amazing recipe! :)

This one rocketed instantly to "company fare". I used blanched almonds instead of pine nuts because that's what I had. Likewise monteray jack instead of parmesan. I'm sure it would be fabulous made as posted, though. I also added a tbsp salted butter. Beautiful.
Waaaaaaaaay too much basil. Ruined my tortellini. Icky
Bland. Looks good on pasta so it gets 3 stars. No flavor. Consider adding salt. Regardless of processing time, there is a gritty/chunky texture in the sauce. Would not make this again.
Triple the recipe otherwise it will disappear to fast :)
Easy and delicious. I cut down the garlic, but other than that it was perfect

It's good! Mine turned out a little too chunky, but I might have over-measure the nuts or under-processed. I will process more thoroughly next time, everything kept sticking to the sides of my processor so it was tough to get the right consistency. I've been mixing the leftover sauce with mayo and using it as an aioli spread.
I didn't have a food processor, so I used the magic bullet and it worked perfectly! This sauce is AMAZING! We put it on Gnocchi! Mmmmmm!
I grow basil in my Aerogarden, and this is an excellent way to use it. It was a big hit. I added cooked, bite-sized pieces of chicken and served it over spaghetti noodles. Thanks for a great recipe.
I grow basil in my Aerogarden, and this is an excellent way to use it. It was a big hit. I added cooked, bite-sized pieces of chicken and served it over spaghetti noodles. Thanks for a great recipe.

I'm only giving this 4 stars because I had to make some adjustments since I didn't have some of the ingredients and so I was never able to make the exact recipe. However, I used most of the ingredients and did the directions and it was very delicious! I didn't have any nuts so I omitted the nuts. I added more parmesan cheese. I didn't have any cream so I ended up making a rue with flour and butter, heating it with a tbsp of cream cheese and added 1%milk. I also added a little cornstarch to thicken it up a little more and it turned out great! I put it over noodles and chicken. So, in the end it was the base recipe with just a few adjustments. I definitely recommend this!
crazy good! I made it for my mom she adored it!

I used this more as guidelines and my version came out very well. I wanted to double it for 2 boxes of pasta, so I used about 1 1/2 pints of half & half, (I also cheated majorly and bought premade pesto) 2 containers of pesto, 1/2 a container of ricotta cheese, about 1 cup grated parmesan cheese, and then after stirring it FOREVER and it not really thickening, I threw in enough flour for it to thicken to my liking. I put this over some sauteed eggplant, onion, mushrooms, & peapods and tossed it with fettuccini and it was delightful... especially for my lactose intolerant hubby :)

This was an easy and tasty quick meal to make. My 11 year-old nephew made this for his family, as I assisted him in the kitchen. I might suggest 3 cloves of garlic for next time, as it was very flavorful.
Simply fantastic!

Very time consuming. Followed directions except used less cream. Extra parmesan cheese and cayanne pepper will help the bland taste. I ran out of parmesan so I used alfredo sauce which is parmesan and cream and it worked perfect. I sauteed mushrooms with chicken. I topped it off with drained diced can tomatoes.
PERFECT! Thank you, thank you ! Thought I was the only one on earth looking for a creamy Basil Sauce !

Incredible! This is the second time I have made it to put over chicken and we just sop up the extras off our plate with the rolls. I use fresh basil from my garden. Couldn't get any better! Thanks for a great recipe.

Oh boy, this was good! I made the sauce for company and they were asking for the recipe. I liked this creamy pesto more than any version I've had in a restaurant. I look forward to making it again soon.

Oh boy, this was good! I made the sauce for company and they were asking for the recipe. I liked this creamy pesto more than any version I've had in a restaurant. I look forward to making it again soon.

I loved this recipe, I made the mistake of putting the cream in before the nuts (I used roasted almonds) which messed a bit with the consistency but delicious. I like others had to thicken the sauce with a flour rue but this is a suject of personal preference. Although in doing this I should have put in additional garlic clove, more basil and a touch more parm. My boyfriend and I put this over homemade pasta for lunch the next day. He really liked it and this man doesnt fib when it comes to food. YUM
Very nice, like basil pesto alfredo combo, loved it!
This was just what I was looking for. It was perfect. Thank you.
Great sauce! 2 things that make it WONDERFUL- add lemon zest and nutmeg to the pesto sauce before combining with the cream sauce.
very good!!

I made this for lunch yesterday and served it with Ozro with Parmesan and Basil from this site. I used soy milk rather than the cream and thickened slightly cornstarch. Very nice taste enjoyed by our entire family...even my 10-year old son who does not give in easily to the site of something green on his plate. My daughter happily ate the leftovers today for lunch.
Delicious!

Good and creamy sauce - my only change was to lightly toast the pine nuts first - this gave it a subtle smokey flavor. Tastes great on tri-color pasta with garbanzo beans; baked chicken; toasted garlic bread; etc.

This so great as is...the only changes I make is to use almonds instead of pine nuts (cost) and sometimes add sundried tomaotes at the end. This sauce is great over any pasta, but esp. tortelini or raviloli.
good! I added a touch of flour to thicken it.

This was awesome. I had no cream and didn't want to hit the store, so I substituted half of a package of lowfat cream cheese and 1/2 cup of 1% milk heated and mixed smooth. I'm sure it would be much better with the cream, but at least this was low in fat. Thanks again.
Very good, basic recipe. You may find yourself adding more of this and that for the flavor and consistency to get exactly where you want it, but it's also very good as written. Thanks for the recipe!

This was phenominal! My fiance didn't care for it very much, but I thought it was awesome. I've never had pesto before, and I'm in love with it now! I followed the recipe exactly and used 12 oz of linguini. The only thing that was difficult is that I do not have a food processor. I used a blender, and it was a bit time consuming, as I had to keep shutting it off and pushing the leaves down to try and chop them up.

I scaled by half but used closer to 1 1/2 cups of basil to use up what I had left. It does need salt but I don't salt because there is enough in the parm that gets grated on top. Tossed with pennette and topped with garlic butter sautéed bay scallops.
Sorry, we didn't really enjoy this. It was pretty bland. At the end, I added lemon juice and salt in an attempt to give it more flavor-still wouldn't make again. Loved the spring green color though!

I made this for a pasta and chicken dish. I made the pesto a day in advance (storing in the fridge) so that I would have less prep while guests were here: all I had to do was add it to the cream. It worked great and received positive feedback from the guests!
This is GREAT! I didn't have lite cream so I used heavy cream it was delish! I just made it for the 2nd time tonight!

I've made people into pesto believers with this sauce (though when you add cream to anything, it's pretty much a winner). Awesome with chicken, could even work with italian sausage. So good and well worth the work!!
Perfect, really easy.
Ok...thought it was pretty bland though. Won't make again.
My other half loved this. I took the advice of others and sauteed mushrooms and garlic, then added the cream. Next time we are adding prosciutto.
